member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.DirList(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Populates a ListBox with a list of files.
member.param: A string whose value is the file pattern. This is usually a mask (for example, *.INI or *.TXT). If you include a path, it becomes the current drive and directory.

An unsigned integer representing one or more types of files you want to list in the ListBox. Types are: 0 - Read/write files 1 - Read-only files 2 - Hidden files 4 - System files 16 - Subdirectories 32 - Archive (modified) files 16384 - Drives 32768 - Exclude read/write files from the list To list several types, add the numbers associated with the types. For example, to list read-write files, subdirectories, and drives, use 0+16+16384 or 16400 for filetype.
member.returns: Returns true if the search path is valid so that the ListBox is populated or the list is empty. DirList returns false if the ListBox cannot be populated (for example, filespec is a file, not a directory, or specifies an invalid path). If any argument's value is null, DirList returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.DirList(System.String,System.Int16,Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.StaticText)
member.summary: Populates a ListBox with a list of files. You can specify a path, a mask, and a file type to restrict the set of files displayed. If the window has an associated StaticText control, DirList can display the current drive and directory as well.
member.param: A string whose value is the file pattern. This is usually a mask (for example, *.INI or *.TXT). If you include a path, it becomes the current drive and directory.

An unsigned integer representing one or more types of files you want to list in the ListBox. Types are: 0 - Read/write files 1 - Read-only files 2 - Hidden files 4 - System files 16 - Subdirectories 32 - Archive (modified) files 16384 - Drives 32768 - Exclude read/write files from the list To list several types, add the numbers associated with the types. For example, to list read-write files, subdirectories, and drives, use 0+16+16384 or 16400 for filetype.
The name of the StaticText in which you want to display the current drive and directory.
member.returns: Returns true if the search path is valid so that the ListBox is populated or the list is empty. DirList returns false if the ListBox cannot be populated (for example, filespec is a file, not a directory, or specifies an invalid path). If any argument's value is null, DirList returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.DirSelect(System.String@)
member.summary: When a ListBox has been populated with the DirList function, DirSelect retrieves the current selection and stores it in a string variable.
member.param: A string variable in which the selected path name will be put.
member.returns: Returns true if the current selection is a drive letter or a directory name (which can contain files and other directories) and false if it is a file (indicating the user's final choice). If any argument's value is null, DirSelect returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.InsertItem(System.String,System.Int16)
member.summary: Insert a item into the listbox at the named position
member.param: The text to be insert into the listbox.
The position to be insert at.
member.returns: Returns the final position of the item. Returns -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.SelectItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Select the item specified by the index/
member.returns: Returns the index number of the selected item. SelectItem returns 0 if itemnumber is not valid or if you specified 0 in order to clear the selected item. It returns -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, SelectItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.SelectItem(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds and highlights an item in a ListBox from the index number and text is your specified string
member.param: the item's text your want to selected
the index from which you want to seach
member.returns: Returns the index number of the selected item. SelectItem returns 0 if itemnumber is not valid or if you specified 0 in order to clear the selected item. It returns -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, SelectItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.SetState(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the highlighted state of an item in a list box. SetState is only applicable to a list box control whose MultiSelect property is set to true.
member.param: The number of the item for which you want to set the state. Specify 0 to set the state of all the items in the ListBox.
A boolean value that determines the state of the item:TRUE - Selected,FALSE - Not selected
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, SetState returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.SetTop(System.Int32)
member.summary: Scrolls a list box control so that the specified item is the first visible item.
member.param: The number of the item you want to become the first visible item
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, SetTop returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.State(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether an item in a ListBox control is highlighted.
member.param: The number of the item for which you want to obtain the state
member.returns: Returns 1 if the item in listboxname identified by index is highlighted and 0 if it is not. If the index does not point to a valid item number, State returns -1. If any argument's value is null, State returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListBox.TotalSelected
member.summary: Determines the number of items in a ListBox control that are selected.
member.returns: Returns the number of items in listcontrolname that are selected. If no items in listcontrolname are selected, TotalSelected returns 0. If an error occurs, it returns -1. If listcontrolname is null, TotalSelected returns null.

member.returns: Returns the text of the selected item in listboxname. Returns the empty string ("") if no items are selected. If listboxname is null, SelectedItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.Text(System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains the text of an item in a ListBox control.
member.param: The number of the item for which you want the text
member.returns: Returns the text of the item in listboxname identified by index. If the index does not point to a valid item number, Text returns the empty string (""). If any argument's value is null, Text returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.DeletePicture(System.Int32)
member.summary: Delete a picture at certain position
member.param: The index postion on which the picture to be delete

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.DeletePictures
member.summary: Delete the Pictures in the picture list box

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.DeleteItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Delte a item from the current list box
member.param: The postion on which the item to be deleted
member.returns: return -1 if a error occurs, otherwise return the remaining items count

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.GetPictureName
member.summary: The the PictureName in array format

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.SetState(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the highlighted state of an item in a list box. SetState is only applicable to a list box control whose MultiSelect property is set to true.
member.param: The number of the item for which you want to set the state. Specify 0 to set the state of all the items in the ListBox.
A boolean value that determines the state of the item:TRUE - Selected,FALSE - Not selected
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, SetState returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.SetDefaultStyleForDescendantClass
member.summary: Set Default Style for descendant class

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.DirList(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Populates a ListBox with a list of files.
member.param: A string whose value is the file pattern. This is usually a mask (for example, *.INI or *.TXT). If you include a path, it becomes the current drive and directory.

An unsigned integer representing one or more types of files you want to list in the ListBox. Types are: 0 - Read/write files 1 - Read-only files 2 - Hidden files 4 - System files 16 - Subdirectories 32 - Archive (modified) files 16384 - Drives 32768 - Exclude read/write files from the list To list several types, add the numbers associated with the types. For example, to list read-write files, subdirectories, and drives, use 0+16+16384 or 16400 for filetype.
member.returns: Returns true if the search path is valid so that the ListBox is populated or the list is empty. DirList returns false if the ListBox cannot be populated (for example, filespec is a file, not a directory, or specifies an invalid path). If any argument's value is null, DirList returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.DirList(System.String,System.Int16,Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.StaticText)
member.summary: Populates a ListBox with a list of files. You can specify a path, a mask, and a file type to restrict the set of files displayed. If the window has an associated StaticText control, DirList can display the current drive and directory as well.
member.param: A string whose value is the file pattern. This is usually a mask (for example, *.INI or *.TXT). If you include a path, it becomes the current drive and directory.

An unsigned integer representing one or more types of files you want to list in the ListBox. Types are: 0 - Read/write files 1 - Read-only files 2 - Hidden files 4 - System files 16 - Subdirectories 32 - Archive (modified) files 16384 - Drives 32768 - Exclude read/write files from the list To list several types, add the numbers associated with the types. For example, to list read-write files, subdirectories, and drives, use 0+16+16384 or 16400 for filetype.
The name of the StaticText in which you want to display the current drive and directory.
member.returns: Returns true if the search path is valid so that the ListBox is populated or the list is empty. DirList returns false if the ListBox cannot be populated (for example, filespec is a file, not a directory, or specifies an invalid path). If any argument's value is null, DirList returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PictureListBox.DirSelect(System.String@)
member.summary: When a ListBox has been populated with the DirList function, DirSelect retrieves the current selection and stores it in a string variable.
member.param: A string variable in which the selected path name will be put.
member.returns: Returns true if the current selection is a drive letter or a directory name (which can contain files and other directories) and false if it is a file (indicating the user's final choice). If any argument's value is null, DirSelect returns null.

member.summary: Gets or sets a description of the control and/or its purpose for use by accessibility tools.

member.summary: Gets or sets a label that briefly describes the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates what kind of user interface element the control is.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether PowerBuilder moves the control to the top of the front-to-back order of the window.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.DragAuto
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether PowerBuilder puts the control automatically into Drag Mode.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.DragIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the stock icon or the file containing the icon you want to use to display when the user drags the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the control, in PowerBuilder units.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.PBTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the tag value assigned to the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.PBWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the control, in PowerBuilder units.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.TabOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the tab value of the control within the window (0 means the user cannot tab to the control).

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control is visible.

member.summary: Gets or sets the X position (distance from the left edge of the window), in PowerBuilder units.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y position (distance from the top of the window), in PowerBuilder units.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.FaceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the typeface in which the text of the control displays.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.FontCharSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the font character set used for the text in the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.FontPitch
member.summary: Gets or sets the pitch (spacing) of the font used for the text in the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.Italic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text in the control is italic.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.PBFontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the font family (type style) used for the text in the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.TextSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the text in the control, in points.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.UnderLine
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text in the control is underlined.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.Weight
member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke weight of the text in the control.

member.summary: Gets the MaxLines property. Overwrite the base property.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.Accelerator

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.AutoHScroll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control automatically scrolls horizontally when data is entered or deleted.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric value of the background color: -2 to 16,777,215.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control has a border.

member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the border of the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text in the control is display only and cannot be changed by user.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control is enabled.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.HideSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether selected text stays selected even when the control does not have focus.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.IMEMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the input method editor mode.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of character that can be entered in the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control is a password field.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text that displays in the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether characters should be displayed in right-to-left order.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.TextCase
member.summary: Gets or sets the case in which text entered in the control display.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.SingleLineEdit.TextColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric value of the color used for text: -2 to 16,777,215.

member.summary: Update the Text property in SelectionChanged event routine

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.AddItem(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the list of values in a list box.
member.param: A string whose value is the text of the item you want to add.
member.returns: Returns the position of the new item. If the list is sorted, the position returned is the position of the item after the list is sorted. Returns -1 if it fails. If any argument's value is null, AddItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.Clear
member.summary: Clears the selected text from the control (but does not place it in the clipboard).
member.returns: For edit controls, returns the number of characters that Clear removed. If no text is selected, no characters are removed and Clear returns 0. If an error occurs, Clear returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.Copy
member.summary: Copies (but does not delete) the selected text from the control to the clipboard.
member.returns: For edit controls, Copy returns the number of characters that were copied to the clipboard. If no text is selected in objectref, no characters are copied and Copy returns 0. If an error occurs, Copy returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.Cut
member.summary: Cuts (deletes) the selected text (if any) from the control and places it in the clipboard.
member.returns: For editable control, Cut returns the number of characters that were cut from control and stored in the clipboard. If no text is selected, no characters are cut and Cut returns 0. If an error occurs, Cut returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.DeleteItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the item indicated by the index from the ListBox portion of the control.
member.param: The position number of the item you want to delete.
member.returns: Returns the number of items remaining in the list of values after the item is deleted. If an error occurs, DeleteItem returns -1. If any argument's value is null, DeleteItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.FindItem(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the first item in the ListBox portion of the control (after the specified index) that begins with a specified string.
member.param: A string whose value is the starting text of the item you want to find.
The number of the item just before the first item to be searched. To search the whole list, specify 0.
member.returns: Returns the index of the first matching item. To match, the item must start with the specified text; however, the text in the item can be longer than the specified text. If no match is found or if an error occurs, FindItem returns -1. If any argument's value is null, FindItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.InsertItem(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the ListBox portion of the DropDownListBox before the item indicated by the index.
member.param: A string whose value is the text of the item you want to insert.
The number of the item in the list before which you want to insert the item.
member.returns: Returns the final position of the item. Returns -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, InsertItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.Paste
member.summary: Inserts the contents of the clipboard (if any) at the cursor location in the control.
member.returns: For edit controls, returns the number of characters that were pasted into control. If nothing has been cut or copied (the clipboard is empty), the Paste function does not change the contents of the edit control and returns 0. If the clipboard contains nontext data and the control cannot accept that data, Paste does not change the contents and returns 0.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.SelectItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds and highlights an item in the control.
member.param: An integer whose value is the location (index) of the item in the ListBox portion of the drop-down list.
member.returns: Returns the index number of the selected item. SelectItem returns 0 if index is not valid or if you specified 0 in order to clear the selected item. It returns -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, SelectItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.SelectItem(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds and highlights an item in the control.
member.param: A string whose value is the starting text of the item you want to select.
The number of the item after which you want to begin the search.
member.returns: Returns the index number of the selected item. If no match is found, SelectItem returns 0; it returns -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, SelectItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.SelectText(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects the text in the control specified by the starting position and length; when the control has focus, highlights the text.
member.param: A long specifying the position at which you want to start the selection.
A long specifying the number of characters you want to select.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters selected. If an error occurs, SelectText returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.GetText(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the text of specified item.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownListBox.Reset
member.summary: Deletes all items from the control.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownPictureListBox.AddItem(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the end of the ListBox portion of the control.
member.param: A string whose value is the text of the item you want to add.
member.returns: Integer. Returns the position of the new item. If the list is sorted, the position returned is the position of the item after the list is sorted. Returns -1 if it fails. If any argument's value is null, AddItem returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.DropDownPictureListBox.AddItem(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the end of the ListBox portion of the control.
member.param: A string whose value is the text of the item you want to add.
An integer specifying the index of the picture you want to associate with the newly added item.
member.returns: Integer. Returns the position of the new item. If the list is sorted, the position returned is the position of the item after the list is sorted. Returns -1 if it fails. If any argument's value is null, AddItem returns null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the BackColor property of InkPicture control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.AccessibleDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the AccessibleDescription property of the control. A description of the control and/or its purpose for use by accessibility tools.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.AccessibleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the AcessibleName property of the control. Specify a label that briefly describes the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.AccessibleRole
member.summary: Gets or sets the AccessibleRole property of the control. Describes what kind of user interface element the control is.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.BringToTop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether PowerBuilder moves the control to the top of the front-to-back order of the window.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.DragAuto
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether PowerBuilder puts the control automatically into Drag Mode.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.DragIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the DragIcon property indicating the icon displays when the control is over an area in which the control can be dropped.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.PBHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the control, in PowerBuilder units.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.PBTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the tag value assigned to the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.PBWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the Width of the control, in PowerBuilder units.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.TabOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the tab value of the control within the window.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is visible.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the X position, in PowerBuilder units.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y position, in PowerBuilder units.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.AutoErase
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the auto erase feature available on some styluses is turned on.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.Border
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control has a border.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the border style value assigned to the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.CollectionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether ink only, gestures only, or ink and gestures are collected.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.DynamicRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ink is rendered (displayed in the control) as it is drawn.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.EditMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the editing mode of the control is set for drawing ink, editing ink, or deleting ink.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.EraserMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether ink is removed by stroke or point.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.EraserWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not ink is removed by stroke or point.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the control is enabled.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.HighContrastInk
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not Specifies whether ink is rendered in a single color when the system is in high contrast mode and draws the selection rectangle and handles in high contrast.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.IgnorePressure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the drawn ink gets wider as the pressure of the pen tip on the tablet surface increases.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.InkAntiAliased
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the foreground and background colors along the edge of the drawn ink are blended (antialiased) to make the stroke smoother and sharper

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.InkColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the current ink color. The default color is black.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.InkEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the InkPicture control collects pen input.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.InkFilename
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file that the ink was loaded from.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.InkHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the side of the rectangular pen tip in pixels. The default is 1.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.InkTransparency
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of drawn ink. The range of values is from 0 for totally opaque (the default) to 255 for totally transparent.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.InkWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the pen in pixels. The default is 53. If the IgnorePressure property is not set, the actual width varies between .5 times the value of the Width property for minimum pressure and 1.5 times its value for maximum pressure.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.MarginX
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-axis margin around the control in PowerBuilder units. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.MarginY
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-axis margin around the control in PowerBuilder units. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.PenTip
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-axis margin around the control in PowerBuilder units. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.PictureFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a file that contains the picture for the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.PictureSizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the picture is displayed in the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.Pointer
member.summary: Gets or sets the Pointer property.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.PowerTipText
member.summary: Gets or sets a PowerTip for the control.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.InkPicture.Status
member.summary: Gets the current status of the control so that the user does not need to monitor the Stroke event.

member.summary: Sets the picture indexes for all items at a particular level.
member.param: The TreeView level for which you are setting the picture indexes
An index from the regular picture list specifying the picture to be displayed when the item is not selected
An index from the regular picture list specifying the picture to be displayed when the item is selected
An index from the state picture list specifying the picture to be displayed to the left of the regular picture
An index from the overlay picture list specifying the picture to be displayed on top of the regular picture

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.TreeView.SetOverlayPicture(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Puts an image in the control's image list into an overlay image list.
member.param: The index number of the overlay picture in the overlay image list. The overlay image list is a 1-based array. Overlayindex must be 1 (for the first image), a previously designated index (replacing an image), or 1 greater than the current largest index (adding another image). SetOverlayPicture fails if you specify an index that creates gaps in the array.

The index number of an image in the control's main image list. For ListViews, both the large and small pictures at that index become overlay images. The image is still available for use as an item's main image.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListView.FindItem(System.Int32,Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.PBDirection,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Search for the next item relative to a specific location in the ListView control.
member.param: The index number from which you want your search to begin.
The direction in which to search. Values are:DirectionAll!DirectionUp!DirectionDown!DirectionLeft!DirectionRight!
If set to true, the search looks for the next ListView item that has focus.
If set to true, the search looks for the next ListView item that is selected.
If set to true, the search looks for the next ListView item that is the target of a cut operation.
If set to true, the search looks for next ListView item that is the target of a drag and drop operation.
member.returns: Integer. Returns the index of the item found if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.Controls.ListView.SetOverlayPicture(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Puts an image in the control's image list into an overlay image list.
member.param: The index number of the overlay picture in the overlay image list. The overlay image list is a 1-based array. Overlayindex must be 1 (for the first image), a previously designated index (replacing an image), or 1 greater than the current largest index (adding another image). SetOverlayPicture fails if you specify an index that creates gaps in the array.

The index number of an image in the control's main image list. For ListViews, both the large and small pictures at that index become overlay images. The image is still available for use as an item's main image.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.
